answers.answer: Being sent home is a good sign. That means they don't think that your preeclampsia is a big enough risk to deal with having a premature baby. Your baby really needs more time in the womb to develop. I know it's frustrating but just try to see it as giving your baby a better start by letting him/her stay in a little longer.

Same thing happened at 34. 4 & he told me we were gonna have her but once i got to l & d my bp stabalized smh it had me frustrated but in the end she needs to cook more..i know its disappointing but its almost done...im on bedrest now until he says shes ready good luck

I was induced at 35+6 because of preeclampsia ... And total apposite I got sent to l&d but never in my mind I had an idea thatI would get induced and have my baby ... But that sure happened I was sad I didnt want to have my baby that early but I had her on 03.12 and thank God I had her normal... Shes healthy and soooo beautiful.. But I was kept in l&d because my bp was still too high and the swelling was still bad ... If I were you I would be more than happy to be sent home your baby is not completely ready to be born
Nevermind came back in and now they are keeping me. Ill know more by morning.  Ill keep u girls updated. Thanks for the advice.

question: Been in l&d for about four hours for my preeclampsia and although dr told me on the phone they were gonna induce me now im here and they are ready to send me home....36/6 and just over being pregnant.
title: ughhh WTF??!
